intro: Agarista villarrealana, commonly known as the Villarreal's agarista, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of many shrubs in its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
